nodes.name: Rigor
nodes.def: the degree to which we are able to infer that the results apply to and across alternate studies and types of people, settings, and times that are beyond the scope of the subjects/contexts of the current research

nodes.name: Validity
nodes.def: The confidence in the outcomes of a study. Evaluated based on the way a study is designed and conducted, in light of the purposes for which the research was undertaken.

nodes.name: Generalizability
nodes.def: The act of reasoning that involves drawing broad conclusions from particular instances; making inferences about the unobserved from the observed.

nodes.name: Internal validity
nodes.def: credibility of the study design and the results

nodes.name: Statistical validity
nodes.def: degree to which a sample represents the population

nodes.name: Theoretical validity
nodes.def: degree to which the particulars and results of a study map to a theory

nodes.name: Ecological validity
nodes.def: degree to which the study occursresults occur under conditions that are typical for the population at large

nodes.name: Replication
nodes.def: deliberate repetition of a study, intended to confirm results

nodes.name: Complementary
nodes.def: independent approaches to confirm, reject, refine, or extend results

nodes.name: Reliability
nodes.def: the consistency, dependability, and predictability of a results

nodes.name: Robustness
nodes.def: the degree to which a result is reliable across a range of people and settings. Does the general effect hold up in the face of wide variations in subject populations and settings?

nodes.name: Transferability
nodes.def: generalize results from one case to another case

nodes.name: Thick description
nodes.def: is rich, thorough descriptive, interpretive, information about the research setting, study participants, and observed transactions and processes

nodes.name: Statistical generalization
nodes.def: inference results from sample to population

nodes.name: Theoretical generalization
nodes.def: confirm, refine, reject, or propose theory from case

nodes.name: Representational Generalization
nodes.def: inferring results from case to real-world

form of generalization that is grounded in qual work
The quality of a generalization is based on the quality of the internal validity of the study such that we have confidence that the results are true
The quality of a generalization is based on the quality of the external validity such that the results are reflective of a broader population or context
Generalization is applied in light of validation having been achieved
Successful replications are most useful for establishing reliability
Reliability is a precondition for internal validity, and is thus an easier argument to make that results are internally valid
Successful complementary studies illustrate the robustness of the finding
Unsuccessful complementary studies can identify the scope of the external validity
robustness -> reliability
robustness -> external validity?
Researcher must provide enough thick description to make transfer possible
Rigor asks Are results believable?
Relevance asks Are results useful?
Strength of internal validity bolsters confidence in results
Strength of external validity bolsters confidence in generalization made based on results
Does the generalization, and hence the result potentially solve real-world problems or improve the quality of life?
Strength of representational validity (rep. gen?) bolsters confidence in generalization made based on results
Relevance requires an evaluation of the value of the results
Reliable assesses internal validity
Robust assesses external validity
Representative assesses ecological validity
Relevant assesses value
For quant, internal validity is confidence that the cause-effect relationship has been established in the context of the particular research setting
For qual, internal validity is confidence that the findings reflect the realities of the people and context under study

Mostly related to qual studies
implicit in theory-driven quant studies

Important part of quant studies
In study design, goal is select a sample that is representative.
